data.text:
"No, I will not despair." 

The strength and resilience of 11-year-old Namaat from Syria is inspirational.

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, @Refugees continues their life-saving work for children like Namaat. https://t.co/yheYIK1ZWq 

https://t.co/57vTzjPcna

Nearly 80% of the world’s students are out of school due to #COVID19. 

@UNESCO has brought together education leaders to share strategies for supporting teachers, students & parents in their home schooling efforts. https://t.co/Q2ibeXkcDA #coronavirus https://t.co/2I0BE1Pu1u

Targeted policy measures could help fight spread of #COVID19 and reduce its impact on human health, but come with difficult economic trade-offs. 

@IMFNews has lessons learned from China's experience with #coronavirus. https://t.co/5Fngan4BfS https://t.co/Tk1h396E1q

Older people are especially vulnerable to loneliness & social isolation during the #COVID19 pandemic.

@ITU has tips on how to help the elderly get online so they can feel better connected with their families & friends during the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/bhGnyACGew https://t.co/SCLX6rZlHD

As the world grapples with the spread of #COVID19, @WHO is using #WorldTBDay to call attention to the persistent risks posed by another deadly respiratory illness - tuberculosis. https://t.co/qDiRrtnFsG #EndTB https://t.co/9V5irg366q
Here's how the UN is fighting #COVID19 and continuing work to achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/3os5yYIOrf

People around the world are doing their part and showing solidarity in the time of #coronavirus.
See some inspiring examples in this @Twitter moment. #COVID19
https://t.co/WUKmHopAkA

As #COVID19 forces more school closures around the world, @WFP is looking for alternative solutions to ensure the millions of children who depend on school meal programmes continue to receive food. https://t.co/dVPbx2a2x1 #coronavirus https://t.co/9eHLZpKkPV
WATCH LIVE: @antonioguterres calls for a global ceasefire amid #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/OQx71vvGmB

Finding it hard to support your child learning at home?

Here are some tips from @UNESCO:
➡️ Structure a daily routine
➡️ Communicate with school
➡️ Monitor your child's progress
➡️ Encourage questions

More: https://t.co/vckoJdPYXY https://t.co/WyBiNjdq5X

The sudden and near-constant stream of news reports about #COVID19 can cause anyone to feel worried. Facts can help to minimize fear.

Get the FACTS on #coronavirus here. https://t.co/tsGUhNhrv2 https://t.co/yfzbkdpXMN

#ClimateAction can continue even during the #COVID19 crisis. 

Switching off lights, even just for a short time, can save more energy than it takes for the light to start up again. 

#ActNow from your home to protect our planet: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/TdNmJBgvbi

The world faces challenges posed by water stress, floods & droughts, and lack of access to clean supplies, in addition to billions in need of handwashing facilities during the #COVID19 crisis. 

More from @WMO on Monday's #WorldMetDay: https://t.co/n0zyiFuRsE https://t.co/JMLQktjoAw

Health is a human right, not a luxury.

Poverty should not be the cause of ill health or a barrier to accessing adequate care. More from @WHO on achieving #HealthForAll: https://t.co/BAjaOUwIFB https://t.co/ZRdwbpdlgB

The UN continues to ramp up its fight against the #coronavirus and to protect the most vulnerable.

See some examples of our work in this @Twitter moment. #COVID19 https://t.co/sqM9KSxcSr

Access to water is a human right & critical during #coronavirus.

Yet, impacts of climate crisis could lead to a world water deficit affecting 685M people.

Details in World Water Development Report: https://t.co/sF8oUkZ6zy #WorldWaterDay via @UNESCO 

 https://t.co/PLREvyDb7o

As people around the world are asked to stay home to prevent further spread of #coronavirus, @UNHumanRights experts highlight the particularly vulnerable situation of those without access to adequate housing. https://t.co/FnLg8osJTw via @UN_SPExperts #COVID19 https://t.co/kgC2QY3xeY

77% of Americans trust @WHO above all other agencies when it comes to coordinating the international response to health crises like the #COVID19 pandemic.

More findings from new @BetterWorldOrg poll ➡️ https://t.co/JWQiYwoozn #coronavirus https://t.co/der3egJgzm
The fight against #coronavirus is everyone's business - and everyone can do something to help. #COVID19 https://t.co/m6D61PuEWA

Half of the world's student population is out school because of the #COVID19 pandemic. 

@UNESCO has launched a global coalition to accelerate the deployment of remote learning solutions. https://t.co/GbWwLXRwqd #coronavirus https://t.co/UKyf8yZXUM

3 billion people live without basic handwashing facilities at home. In the face of #COVID19, they are among the most vulnerable & the at risk.

Help mobilize action for access to hand hygiene on Sunday's #WorldWaterDay: https://t.co/gtABX0017e #coronavirus https://t.co/5KwhgsvKiw

With schools closed & parents struggling to care for children while making ends meet amid the #COVID19 crisis, risks for children are mounting.

@UNICEF has new guidance on how to help keep children safe during the #coronavirus pandemic: https://t.co/t3TjQO3PS5 https://t.co/jWjEgMR2uM
.@FAO is further scaling up efforts to fight the desert locust outbreak in East Africa with the help of a US$10 million loan from @UNCERF. https://t.co/R3iVORFUSM https://t.co/XIfumktbEL

1 world. 7.5+ billion unique faces.

Diversity is a strength, not a threat.

In these difficult times - and always - we must take a stand against intolerance and discrimination. 

Saturday is #FightRacism Day. https://t.co/lf77gPn1bN https://t.co/3dUJ5iWNHA

Poems can provide comfort in times of crisis, including amid the #COVID19 pandemic. 

On Saturday's #WorldPoetryDay, share a poem that has helped you during a difficult time. https://t.co/qiPMlAgoRz https://t.co/mhOcOZkcoa

People with Down syndrome must have meaningful participation in decision-making on issues affecting their lives, including during this time of global crisis. 

More on Saturday's World Down Syndrome Day: https://t.co/GrH2Oli4Kd #WDSD20 https://t.co/w1pMo1ser9

The @WorldBank explains the connection between the protection of wildlife and human health and how the illegal trade of pangolins could be at the heart of the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/TOb9KxyqO2

Every year, #Nowruz is celebrated as a day of hope & renewal.

At a time of global anxiety caused by #coronavirus, thoughts & solidarity are with all those marking Nowruz. https://t.co/QYKJspbEEm https://t.co/cUGEvTaA0m

"It is shameful to see increasing acts of racial discrimination and prejudice as we fight the #COVID19 pandemic - a crisis that affects us all."
- @antonioguterres on Saturday's #FightRacism Day https://t.co/3gCowFvJwN https://t.co/qlka27AKhM

UN teams on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic are leveraging virtual tools to collaborate and mobilize resources in response to #coronavirus. 
https://t.co/W9dtbIGVdQ

Economic stimulus packages to tackle #COVID19 can support environmentally-friendly business & personal practices, with need for #ClimateAction remaining urgent, says @WMO. https://t.co/kS7p6AN8KJ https://t.co/SDROj04YS6

“More than ever before, we need solidarity, hope and the political will to see this through together." 

-- @antonioguterres on the need for global cooperation in response to the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/nvpqjshc5K https://t.co/GzcEC38o3C
The UN has partnered with @Whatsapp to share real-time health information about #COVID19 with local communities around the world. - via @UNDP https://t.co/4d7U7l0p55

We are facing a global health crisis.

This a moment that demands coordinated, decisive & innovative action.

This is, above all, a human crisis that calls for solidarity.

-- @antonioguterres on #COVID19 https://t.co/g4EKemD0OY https://t.co/7Yvuz82yBa

The global #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund has raised more than $43 million in the last week.

Donations will help @WHO buy supplies & tests, improve surveillance of the #coronavirus crisis and more. https://t.co/YazWTVwFq4 https://t.co/9k9pscPR4D

300 million people speak French around the world.

On Friday's French Language Day, and every day, follow @ONU_fr to get updates on the #coronavirus pandemic & more ... en français. https://t.co/4KxxOk5N2X

“At a time when the world is struggling to fight a pandemic, the focus of the parties must shift away from fighting one another to ensuring the population will not face even graver risks.”
- @OSE_Yemen expresses concern about escalating conflict in Yemen. https://t.co/vgV7jRnfoD

"More than ever before, we need solidarity, hope and the political will to see this crisis through together." 

-- @antonioguterres on the need for global unity to tackle the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/jkXXxBNAUw

It has been proven that #COVID19 can be contained - and it must be contained.  

More than ever before, we need solidarity, hope and the political will to see this through together.

-@antonioguterres https://t.co/g4EKemlpXq #coronavirus https://t.co/MNrPzg85zj

More than 860 million children are out of school because of the #COVID19 pandemic. 

@UNESCO has pulled together a global coalition of partners to help countries launch remote learning systems. https://t.co/GbWwLY97ON https://t.co/uUCWtkB27E
WATCH LIVE:  ⁦@antonioguterres⁩ takes questions on the #COVID19 pandemic and stresses the importance of global solidarity in response to #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/So8QVjnBy3

Maintaining a healthy perspective is important for those asked to self-isolate or quarantine due to #COVID19. 

Pay attention to your feelings🧘‍♂️ 
Engage in relaxing activities 📖 
Keep sleep routines & a nutritious diet 🍎

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/DPcAWhh6Wt https://t.co/Ou0Axybulw

"We are in this together – and we will get through this, together."

-- @antonioguterres urges global solidarity & compassion as countries around the world address the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/2zxrPa1MMY https://t.co/XhrrU4tZJX

Women are on the frontline of the #COVID19 response -- as health workers, caregivers & community leaders. 

@UN_Women explains how prioritizing women’s needs & leadership will strengthen the #coronavirus response. https://t.co/V99pdCwoOF https://t.co/CIc3DRQD4q

Prioritizing mental health is of critical importance during times of high stress amid the #COVID19 crisis. 

Stay in contact with friends & family 📱 
Take breaks from the news 📰 
Practice mindfulness 🧘‍♀️ 

Get wellness resources here: https://t.co/p08qySDuew https://t.co/GYKSDtTTVJ

As the #coronavirus outbreak impacts people's lives around the world, our @UNDP colleague shares the story of her personal experience with #COVID19 and the importance of preventing stigma & spreading compassion to fight the pandemic. 

https://t.co/k01tg2twCn

#COVID19 is affecting all areas of life.

The UN is working around the world to tackle the #coronavirus and protect the most vulnerable. See some examples of our efforts in this @Twitter moment.

https://t.co/W2OpELcfiA

The UN is mobilizing resources and expertise around the world to help with the global #COVID19 response.

From out-of-school children to the homeless, here's how we are helping some of those hit hardest by the pandemic. https://t.co/CfKcipBwd0 https://t.co/31v1W6bbFJ

"Through it, we keep going. We do what needs to be done."

-- Tina is one of the @UNICEF staff members who went to Mozambique a year ago after Cyclones Idai & Kenneth left 1.3 million children in need of assistance. https://t.co/fFLNofwJXP

https://t.co/mjrdj6yaOI

As the economic impacts of the #COVID19 outbreak deepen, @ilo calls for an immediate & coordinated response to protect workers, stimulate economies and reduce negative effects on employment. #coronavirus
https://t.co/lEKj1DNjWa

Some countries affected by #coronavirus were already facing serious humanitarian challenges from conflicts, natural disasters & the climate crisis.

@UNOCHA continues its life-saving work in these countries, including by supporting their #COVID19 response. https://t.co/kTYevxNGT2

As people everywhere take steps to protect themselves from #COVID19, many are spending more time indoors and online.

See how @UNVolunteers is helping - and how you can get involved: https://t.co/HKSAvdwyos https://t.co/EvvT7QJyhn

Increases in the frequency of diseases such as #coronavirus being passed from animals to humans is linked to the destruction of natural habitats.

@UNEP explains how protecting ecosystems can also help protect human health. #ClimateAction https://t.co/0CoWxZu6kg
Amid #COVID19 outbreak, @WFP monitoring food prices & markets and lending expertise to governments seeking to avoid panic about food supplies. #ZeroHunger https://t.co/EifKQjB8Qm

The #coronavirus outbreak can be a worrying time for children. 

@UNICEF has 8 tips on how to protect and comfort children during these difficult times. #COVID19 https://t.co/ikROwjAhwv

People around the world are doing their part and showing solidarity in the time of #coronavirus. See some inspiring examples in this @Twitter moment. #COVID19

https://t.co/C2ue73p56f

The UN continues to help countries around the world tackle the #coronavirus outbreak, as people everywhere show solidarity & kindness. #COVID19 
https://t.co/8aCRQhh321

As the number of #coronavirus cases soars in southeast Asia, @WHO is supporting national governments as they urgently scale-up aggressive measures to combat #COVID19. https://t.co/gvzqlyZ8v0 https://t.co/50hdjMVSQQ
With the #coronavirus spreading, we are mobilizing our global workforce to help countries contain or slow #COVID19. https://t.co/zbaomTiQpz

Countdown toward declaring Democratic Republic of Congo Ebola-free continues after last patient was recently released from treatment centre.

@WHO played critical role in Ebola response and remains vigilant as communities move forward in their recovery. https://t.co/Yqurhi3ihv https://t.co/KA2EPUpud0

#COVID19: Governments must not abuse emergency measures to suppress human rights, say @UNHumanRights experts, calling for proportionate, necessary & non-discriminatory #coronavirus response. 
https://t.co/ljJqS7w9Hy

The #coronavirus has created a lot of anxiety around the world, but this time of global crisis also brings out the best in people. See some inspiring examples in this @Twitter moment. #COVID19

https://t.co/hN5HyoeSSA

🇺🇳 THANK YOU to all of our 12 million followers for your trust and support. 🇺🇳

Stay tuned for more on the UN's work around the 🌏, including reliable updates on the current #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/mu34yZMwlH

Amid increasing hostilities, 2,500+ people have been returned to Libya this year alone. Most of them ended up in detention. 

@UNmigration calls for urgent action to establish an alternative to returning vulnerable migrants to Libya. https://t.co/aA7HLXfwTG

If children you care for have concerns about #COVID19, addressing their feelings together may help ease their anxiety. 

@WHO has tips on how to support children amid the #coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/ZjUxkt4Lca https://t.co/OPdSYlc87j
#Coronavirus has affected people all over the 🌎. Be empathetic. We all need support, compassion and kindness. https://t.co/3EHAHjd0ND #COVID19

"While #COVID19 has stopped us going to our workplace, it hasn’t stopped our work." 

-- @WFPChief explains that @WFP continues its vital work for people in need, despite #coronavirus outbreak affecting operations at their Rome headquarters. https://t.co/7eLKUtqnsl

The sudden and near-constant stream of news reports about #COVID19 can cause anyone to feel worried. 

Facts can help to minimize fear. Get the FACTS on #coronavirus, not the rumors and misinformation: https://t.co/tsGUhMZQ6s https://t.co/OFJMhehqQi

.@FAO is stepping up its efforts to combat the desert locust outbreak in the Horn of Africa by using ✈️and 🚁 to expand its operations and cover larger areas. https://t.co/Qftr8Sommo https://t.co/9bnBM1h9Zo

It's always hard to assess whether you've prevented a conflict from happening, but the Security Council has had a tremendous impact.

-- @UNDPPA Chief @DicarloRosemary provides a behind-the-scenes look at the difficult work of the UN Security Council. https://t.co/QQ1iJdgQ5Q https://t.co/0daCkxppId
Despite measures to safeguard staff & prevent spread of #COVID19, the UN remains open for business, determined to deliver for the people we serve: https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/XNAx5ZQA8e

Stay up-to-date on latest developments regarding #COVID19 outbreak, including how the UN is supporting the response effort.

Get #coronavirus updates here: https://t.co/3EHAHjd0ND https://t.co/uBYb3yxsUo

#COVID19 is a threat unlike any other in our lifetimes. 
We must look after each other and protect the vulnerable.
We are in this together – and we will get through this, together. 

-- @antonioguterres on #coronavirus https://t.co/3EHAHjd0ND https://t.co/42Tq8BClSa

New poll finds 77% of Americans trust @WHO above other entities when it comes to managing response to international health crises like #coronavirus. 

More from @BetterWorldOrg: https://t.co/V53MFNcxDq #COVID19 https://t.co/royfDr8Bn0

2.2 million people have been forced to flee South Sudan.
83% of them are women and children. 

Urgent funding is needed to provide life-saving assistance. More from @refugees: https://t.co/doaCMy0J41

Health is a human right, not a luxury. 

Poverty should not be the cause of ill health or a barrier to accessing adequate care. More from @WHO on achieving #HealthForAll: https://t.co/BAjaOUOjx9 https://t.co/rvyiq81ug5

The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed the need for the world's economies to pursue more diversified and sustainable business models, says @UNCTAD. https://t.co/dbqsL6bE95 #coronavirus https://t.co/knfostTppq

The number of young people being left out of the job market and training or educational activities is on the rise. 

New @ILO report sheds light on the uncertain future many youth are facing. https://t.co/UDjqlu77u3

No country or community can solve the complex problems of our world alone. Global cooperation is more important than ever. 

Share your ideas about how we can build a better future together. https://t.co/PowOJteUld #UN75 https://t.co/ztvjLc0WkF

Every day, all around the world, nurses & midwives provide essential care services and save lives, including during the current #COVID19 outbreak.

2020 is the Year of the Nurse & Midwife. https://t.co/gXH9xApYS7 #HealthForAll https://t.co/6ewXhvmMwK
Growing insecurity hinders humanitarian efforts in Burkina Faso, as the number of displaced people reaches almost 800,000: https://t.co/1x16zZ6iMC via @refugees https://t.co/voW4bNzifb

#COVID19 pandemic: Get 5 key facts about #coronavirus, including tips on how to keep yourself & others around you healthy. 
https://t.co/bWVPdFIPct

Ahmed is among the millions of people in need of humanitarian aid as the conflict in Syria enters its 10th year. 

@UNOCHA explains how you can help: https://t.co/7UTVQkCJ1l #NotATarget https://t.co/rzSbX59FDt

Reliable and up-to-date facts are are essential to help prevent the spread of #COVID19. 

Get UN resources & updates on #coronavirus here: https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/9yI44i091C

New natural farming practice in India helps increase crop yields & reduce costs.

@UNEP explains how the zero budget natural farming practice helps improve food security & build resilience against the impacts of the climate crisis. https://t.co/MnmDeRW2iJ https://t.co/5815ZDJ9PU

Preventing the further spread of #COVID19 is a shared responsibility for us all. 

We stand in full solidarity with you.

We are in this together – and we will get through this, together.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/2zxrPajoby #coronavirus https://t.co/nkTc6hvmcC

"It's incredibly important to have women at the table in any kind of peace process."

-- @DiCarloRosemary talks about her role as the first woman to lead @UNDPPA, and her work on the UN Security Council. https://t.co/ZX0dasLO9T #GenerationEquality https://t.co/oTlm4hheFu

People, businesses & organizations can now contribute to the global #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund.

Donations will help @WHO buy supplies, tests and improve surveillance & research to tackle the #coronavirus. https://t.co/YazWTVf41u https://t.co/ZBo7HmQeQk

🔸 Politics
🔸 Economics
🔸 Education
These are some of the areas where gender bias is most prevalent. 

New @UNDP study highlights the vast power gaps that still exist between men & women worldwide. https://t.co/kGY226A0PN

 https://t.co/DXCKpRjDeI

#ClimateAction and gender equality can go hand-in-hand. 
Thanks to a unique @UNDP initiative in Jordan, a recycling centre provides stable jobs for women, while also helping to protect the planet's resources. https://t.co/E4v1zaAYwa

Women can play a key role in conflict resolution and peacebuilding. 

@UNPeacekeeping is working to ensure women's full, equal & meaningful participation in peace processes. https://t.co/2ZWmQcy1cj #A4P https://t.co/xVjeeUPQ5M

After years of exile in Angola, thousands of displaced people are returning home to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. 

See how @Refugees is supporting them as emotions run high: https://t.co/QWmXbJ1J8v https://t.co/zjcuKu9hfW

Yemen: Renewed fighting has placed country at a critical juncture, @OSE_Yemen tells Security Council, but hope for a peaceful political process remains within reach. https://t.co/C1jObjPI4t https://t.co/x0WNYU91A3

Looking for information on #coronavirus? 

Get UN resources & updates here: https://t.co/3EHAHjd0ND #COVID19 https://t.co/u12NKSElUE

As the conflict in Syria enters its 10th year, @antonioguterres stresses need to protect civilians & find lasting political solution. 

$3.3 billion needed to continue providing aid to those affected by violence.   https://t.co/AiV1iXFlhy

As anxiety over the worldwide spread of #coronavirus rises, following simple steps can help keep you, and those around you, healthy. 

More facts from @WHO: https://t.co/IiaPWjhZ7G #COVID19 https://t.co/9d1HHWOEQc
